intro: Sebastiania schottiana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to the Caribbean, this plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure for optimal growth.
